column4: How do i create a laucher to access my private? Because currently I have to do cd $Home and ecryptfs-mount-private after i log in
I think that hidden file that's in Private before you mount it tells you how, does it?
what you mean?'
is your private directory mounted now?
yea
can you unmount it?
ok, and then what do you see inside it using a terminal?
inside what?
the private directory
can you paste what the instructions on yours, mine is messed up
I don't have ecryptfs installed here
is this right ln -s /usr/share/ecryptfs-utils/ecryptfs-mount-/home/iluminator101/Access-Your-Private-Data.desktop
probably not.  Look slike you need a space
well is it...
i am trying to copy /etc to /dev/sdb1/hp2back2/etc1
I saw.  What did the error tell you?  Check if the error is lying to you or not.
etc1 is a folder
ls -ld /dev/sdb1/hp2backup2/etc1
wait, why /dev???
its an external harddrive
you don't access it through /dev.   You mount it somewhere
why not a directory error i am following at all
doesn't matter, did you see what I told you about mounting?
cp -R /etc/* /media/Expansion drive same error why
